data.event: Less than a decade after Mississippi became the country's 20th state, settlers carved out a 700-square mile of pine forests and streams for a new county in 1826.

event.title: carved out a 700-square mile of pine forests and streams for a new county in 1826

data.event: Less than a decade after Mississippi became the country's 20th state, settlers carved out a 700-square mile of pine forests and streams for a new county in 1826.

event.title: the election of Abraham Lincoln as United States president in November 1860

data.event: Soon after the election of Abraham Lincoln as United States president in November 1860, slave-owning planters led Mississippi to join South Carolina and secede from the Union in January 1861.
By 1860, slaves made up only 12% of the total population in Jones County, the smallest percentage of any county in the state.
